categories.name: Operational Support & Troubleshooting
categories.description: Recognition focused on immediate, specific actions taken to resolve technical issues, fix errors, or ensure continuity during critical periods (like launches or holidays).

subcategories.name: Rapid Incident Response
subcategories.description: Quickly identifying, fixing, and deploying solutions for urgent technical problems or application errors.
examples: found the source of the problem and quickly managed to prep the hotfix
tackling the security scanning issues

subcategories.name: System/Data Integrity & Maintenance
subcategories.description: Ensuring accuracy, stability, and proper function of core systems, data models, or processes, often involving testing or complex data handling.
examples: system calculation checks, updating reports
cancelling 2000 anniversary awards

subcategories.name: Urgent/Time-Sensitive Delivery
subcategories.description: Action taken under pressure to meet tight deadlines or support time-sensitive client deliverables.
examples: support with a time sensitive data model deploy
ensured they were efficiently reviewed and actioned

categories.name: Knowledge Sharing & Mentorship
categories.description: Recognition for teaching, guiding, or sharing specialized expertise that enables others to learn, grow, or solve complex problems independently.

subcategories.name: Direct Mentoring & Guidance
subcategories.description: Providing structured or informal coaching, advice, and sharing of best practices to develop a colleague's skills.
examples: best mentor I could ask for... sharing all of your tips, templates and advice
guidance whether its around the wilson score work, skills

subcategories.name: Expert Consultation & Unblocking
subcategories.description: Using deep knowledge to explain complex topics, resolve tricky customer cases, or unblock others' thinking.
examples: help me find answers buried deep in documentation
clarity and patience in the way he explained everything

categories.name: Proactive Ownership & Initiative
categories.description: Recognition for taking independent responsibility, driving work forward without being asked, or demonstrating exceptional drive and commitment.

subcategories.name: Driving Momentum & Hustle
subcategories.description: Recognition for sustained high activity, consistent effort, and maintaining pace, especially during slow periods.
examples: activity and hustle you have put in lately
keeping the momentum of cold calling and outreach going

subcategories.name: Taking Ownership of Problems
subcategories.description: Stepping up to own a problem end-to-end, from identification through to resolution and communication.
examples: see you take ownership of the problem, driving home the fix
your proactive approach

subcategories.name: Forward-Thinking & Foundation Setting
subcategories.description: Work that establishes significant, long-term value or sets the stage for future initiatives.
examples: will serve as the foundation for the Spend 2.0 initiatives
work on solving the next big thing

categories.name: Cross-Functional Partnership & Collaboration
categories.description: Appreciation for seamless teamwork, effective coordination across different teams or stakeholders, and maintaining positive working relationships.

subcategories.name: Seamless Teamwork & Coverage
subcategories.description: Providing reliable support to cover for absent colleagues or ensuring smooth operations across shared responsibilities.
examples: looking after my tasks while I was away
support, teamwork, and positive energy you've brought throughout the year

subcategories.name: Stakeholder Alignment & Coordination
subcategories.description: Effectively managing complex dependencies, scheduling, and communication between multiple internal/external groups (Legal, Finance, Clients).
examples: scheduling calls with the right folks... worked closely with our Legal/Finance teams
ensured that we had the smoothest week

categories.name: Impactful Delivery & Quality of Work
categories.description: Recognition tied directly to the successful completion of major projects, innovations, or achieving measurable business results.

subcategories.name: Major Project/Feature Launch Success
subcategories.description: Successful delivery of significant, complex, or high-visibility initiatives.
examples: delivering the initial Out-of-the-Box Spend 2.0 UI
successfully delivering the Budget Management 2.0 fix

subcategories.name: Innovation & Technical Advancement
subcategories.description: Creating new tools, processes, or technical solutions that improve efficiency or product capability significantly.
examples: Automated Translations innovation will make a meaningful difference
content extraction tool that formed the basis of tons of Smart Assistant rules

subcategories.name: Client/User Value Focus
subcategories.description: Demonstrating exceptional attention to detail specifically aimed at improving the end-user or client experience.
examples: attention to detail with focus towards bringing great value to our users
ensuring our customers experience is at the forefront

categories.name: Cultural & Interpersonal Excellence
categories.description: Recognition for embodying positive personal attributes, maintaining team morale, and demonstrating strong character traits.

subcategories.name: Positive Attitude & Energy
subcategories.description: Bringing enthusiasm, positivity, and a good sense of humor to daily interactions and challenging situations.
examples: always with a positive mindset
bring the BEST energy into every room

subcategories.name: Team Cohesion & Support
subcategories.description: Actions that foster a strong sense of community, kindness, and mutual support within the team structure.
examples: care, kindness, and resilience shine so brightly
being a real team in all senses of the word

subcategories.name: Personal Milestones & Appreciation
subcategories.description: Non-work related recognition, such as celebrating birthdays, life events, or acknowledging personal achievements outside of immediate job scope.
examples: Congratulations on winning the Best Overall Innovation Award
Congratulations James and Grace on the arrival of your beautiful baby boy

reasoning: The messages heavily emphasize immediate, reactive support (C1) and proactive effort/ownership (C3), which are distinct from the successful outcomes (C5). Collaboration (C4) is a frequent theme, often involving cross-functional partners. Finally, a significant portion of recognition is dedicated to interpersonal skills, mentorship (C2), and general positive culture contribution (C6), necessitating categories beyond just task completion.
